page.title: 11ARMED FORCES
page.content: The Junior Leaders Regiment, Royal Artillery, Gamecock Barracks, Nuneaton. It covers an area of approx. 1. Sq. mile. Buildings include: offices and administration, junior soldiers accommodation, married quarters, education block, sports facilities, including rifle ranges, assault course, football pitches, and swimming pool. Old aircraft hangars serve as sports halls, housing ski slope and artificial rock face for climbing. Ameneties for the soldiers includefood shop,which also sells electrical goods such as televisions. There is a small post office and club. Soldiers spend one year at the barracks and are then said to be trained for leadership. They are paid Â£25 per week, Â£10 of which is retained until they go home at the of 14 weeks for a holiday.
